page.title: 20Conservation:The River Ouse.
page.content: An interview with the local Water Bailiff: "The section you see in front of you is fairly typical of a{lowland river. Two years ago it was so overgrown with fallen trees that something rather drastic had to be done to prevent the channel from becoming blocked & flood- ing adjacent farmland. It entailed the cutting back of a number of trees so that the roots were left, but this is not always possible. This river bank looks{natural.}You can see the new growth coming from the stool or stump of the Alders. It need not be touched for another twenty years or more. I try to get the River looking as I like to see it; the banks aren't laid bare but have plenty of flora and fauna." { LITTLE HORSTED C.E. PRIMARY SCHOOL {2nd,3rd & 4th Year Pupils
